duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide professional nursing services under the direction of a RN in compliance with healthcare standards and regulations.
Provide skilled nursing interventions for patient/clients illness, rehabilitative needs, and preventative care.
Utilize a holistic approach in the provision of problem-specific therapeutic interventions, teaching, and training activities in accordance with the plan of care.
Maintain contact with patients, physicians, clinical managers, and other members of the healthcare team regarding patient/family needs and status changes.
Participate in care coordination activities and discharge planning as appropriate.
Prepare, submit, and maintain documentation as required by the Company and/or facility.
Maintain the highest standards of professional conduct in relation to patient information that is confidential in nature.
Maintain consistent communication to ensure adherence to professional standards in the provision and availability of supplies, materials, and equipment needed to implement the plan of care.
Visit/shift notes documented on the day services are rendered.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of an accredited Licensed Practical Nursing Program or accredited School of Vocational Nursing.
Current nursing license in the practicing state.
Valid driver's license, auto insurance and reliable transportation.
Two years experience as an LPN/LVN in a clinical setting, preferably in a home health or hospice setting.
